attributes.comment:
Adoptive Parents -Paul & Lisa are opposed to the increases - especially
for adoptive applicants. Adoption is already a costly expense, we are
recommending that the fees for adoption should be held because, for many of us,
we have to file TWICE because the approval is only good for 18 months. With
adoptions taking longer and longer, most adoptive paretns have to file again as
you do not permit us to renew our filing - and make us pay the full price again!
Adoptive families are trying to help the outrageous number of orphaned children
of the world find their forever home. The children deserve it - they did not
choose the circumstance they were born into by their parents. Please help it
remain "attainable" for the working class families. We do not want to get loans
to extend our families, nor do we want to see such an painful increase from your
office. We really are just working class citizens trying to forefill our dreams
and desires of helping a child live a life worth living, and not in an orphage.

Here is what it currently costs to file with USCIS for a couple just to adopt:

What it used to be when adoptions took place within 18 months:

I600A: $545

Fingerprints: $70 x 2 = $140

Total: $685

What it will be now that adoptions are taking longer plus the increase:

I600A: $670 x 2 = $1340

Fingerprints: $80 x 4 = $ 320

Total: $1660

That's an increase of $975 or over 140%! That's unreasonable, especially with no
increase in services.

And that's not even taking into consideration the fact that applying for our
children's Certificate of Citizenship (for IR4 visas) goes from $215 to
$460, a difference of $245 or about 120% increase. Sometimes, for what we've
been told, one doesn't get the certificates for a year after filing!

Please reconsider your increases. If you do deem them necessary, at least
consider a "renewal" fee for those who already endured the first fee.

Thank you,
Colorado Citizens
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Paul and Lisa
